channel.title: Enforce sign-in for Docker Desktop on Docker Docs

item.title: Ways to enforce sign-in for Docker Desktop
item.description: This page outlines the different ways you can enforce sign-in for Docker Desktop. Registry key method (Windows only) Early Access The registry key method is an early access feature. It's available with Docker Desktop version 4.32 and later. Create the registry key. Your new key should look like the following: $ HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Docker\Docker Desktop Create a multi-string value allowedOrgs. Important Only one entry for allowedOrgs is currently supported. If you add more than one value, sign-in enforcement silently fails.
